java112.analyzer

Class AnalyzeFile

  • java.lang.Object
    • java112.analyzer.AnalyzeFile

  • public class AnalyzeFile
extends java.lang.Object
    The AnalyzeFile class contains the runAnalysis method, and calls the writeOutputFile method
    Author:
    sschwert

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      AnalyzeFile() 

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void createAnalyzers()
      the createAnalyzers method instantiates the list of analyzerObjects which implement the Analyzer interface and passes them the properties object and puts them into an array list
      void generateTokens(java.lang.String[] tokens)
      the generateTokens method loops through the bits created from the splitFile method and makes sure they aren't empty, then calls the processToken method
      void loadProperties(java.lang.String propertiesFilePath)
      the loadProperties method instantiates the properties object and loads the propertiesFilePath to the getResourceAsStream method in a try/catch block
      void processTokens(java.lang.String token)
      the processTokens method begins the token processing by calling the processToken method on each analyzer in the analyzerObjects ArrayList
      void readFile(java.lang.String inputFilePath)
      the readFile method opens, reads, calls the splitFile method, and closes the file, whose path is input at the command line
      void runAnalysis(java.lang.String[] arguments)
      The runAnalysis method does most of the actions for the program by calling the other major methods for the program
      void splitFile(java.io.BufferedReader reader)
      the splitFile method reads the file and separates all the words on non-word characters ("\\W"), then calls the generate tokens method
      boolean testArguments(java.lang.String[] commandLineArgs)
      the testArguments method will make sure there are only two argument entered on the command line
      void writeAllOutputFiles()
      the writeAllOutput method writes the summary files by calling the writeOutputFile method on each analyzer in the analyzerObjects ArrayList and outputs a friendly messagee

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

      • runAnalysis

        public void runAnalysis(java.lang.String[] arguments)
        The runAnalysis method does most of the actions for the program by calling the other major methods for the program
        Parameters:
        arguments - is an array of Strings from the command line

      • testArguments

        public boolean testArguments(java.lang.String[] commandLineArgs)
        the testArguments method will make sure there are only two argument entered on the command line
        Parameters:
        commandLineArgs - an array of arguments from the command line
        Returns:
        false if there are not two and only two arguments

      • createAnalyzers

        public void createAnalyzers()
        the createAnalyzers method instantiates the list of analyzerObjects which implement the Analyzer interface and passes them the properties object and puts them into an array list

      • loadProperties

        public void loadProperties(java.lang.String propertiesFilePath)
        the loadProperties method instantiates the properties object and loads the propertiesFilePath to the getResourceAsStream method in a try/catch block
        Parameters:
        propertiesFilePath - is a string representing the location of the properties file

      • readFile

        public void readFile(java.lang.String inputFilePath)
        the readFile method opens, reads, calls the splitFile method, and closes the file, whose path is input at the command line
        Parameters:
        inputFilePath - a String, the path of a file that is input at the command line

      • splitFile

        public void splitFile(java.io.BufferedReader reader)
               throws java.io.IOException
        the splitFile method reads the file and separates all the words on non-word characters ("\\W"), then calls the generate tokens method
        Parameters:
        reader - is a BufferedReader
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - from the buffered reader, to be dealt with later...

      • generateTokens

        public void generateTokens(java.lang.String[] tokens)
        the generateTokens method loops through the bits created from the splitFile method and makes sure they aren't empty, then calls the processToken method
        Parameters:
        tokens - is an array of Strings

      • processTokens

        public void processTokens(java.lang.String token)
        the processTokens method begins the token processing by calling the processToken method on each analyzer in the analyzerObjects ArrayList
        Parameters:
        token - is a String which is a single token from the generateTokens method

      • writeAllOutputFiles

        public void writeAllOutputFiles()
        the writeAllOutput method writes the summary files by calling the writeOutputFile method on each analyzer in the analyzerObjects ArrayList and outputs a friendly messagee
